name: Cheesecake Workshop
description: This class is for all the cheescake lovers. Here at Flourish, we teach you a variety of cheesecakes that range with technique and flavour. Tips, tricks and methods pertaining to perfecting your cheesecake is covered in this class. A variety of 3 cheesecakes is taught.-Baked New York Cheesecake -Frozen Fruit Cheesecake -Cotton Cheesecake (Japanese Cheesecake) All information regarding the baking of these widely different cheesecake will be passed on to our students. We provide you with all the ingredients, tools and know-how for the class including a handout which you will be taking home. Along with that, you will be taking the lovely cheesecakes you've made at the class, back home to your friends and family. Join us for a fun filled, cheese-centric workshop! Cheers!

name: Food Nerd Festival - Immersives 2024 - Bangalore: All Day Pass
description: Food Nerd Festival is a celebration of all things food! So this festival is for anyone who’s obsessed with food! Whether you're a chef, foodie, flavour geek, or love to nerd out over the latest culinary trends and techniques, the Food Nerd Festival is your jam.With 4 workshops centred around the basic cooking elements, these immersives will leave you with an elevated culinary game.Salt by Chef Gautam & Bala (@gonzogarbanzo & @saltycuredpigs) (11-12:30)Guided Overview & History Of Preservation TechniquesExploring Techniques Of Pickling & Preserving In India & Around The WorldUnderstanding Curing Salts & The Science Behind ThemExpert Tips On Mastering Salt, Time, & FermentationLive Demonstration Of A Traditional Pickling TechniqueLive Demonstration Of A Meat Curing TechniqueRecipes For Pickling & Curing Bacon At HomeFat by Heena Punwani (@tiffintales, founder of Maska Bakery) (1:00-2:30)Cracking The Code Of Baking Theory: The Science Behind ItThe History Of Fats In CookingUnderstanding Different Fats In Indian BakingCookie Tasting Session Showcasing Different FatsOil Vs. Ghee: Flavor ShowdownLive Fat-Washing Cocktail DemoAcid by Payal Shah (@kobofermentery) (3:00-4:30)Exploring Indian Vinegars & Its Usage In Indian Cooking & HistoryLive Demonstration Of Vinegar Making.Breakdown Of The Science Behind The TechniqueA Vinegar-Tasting Experience of 5 vinegars.Hands-On Shrub-Based Drink MakingHeat by Chef Gresham Fernandes (@greshamfernandes) (5:00-6:30)Discover the Secrets of Heat SourcesUncover the chemistry behind how heat worksLearn the wonders of wood-fired cookingPro techniques for smoking foodUsing heat to create different textures: dry jerky vs fish roast. Disclaimer: Programming is subject to change, please watch out for an official email a few days before the actual workshop.

name: Roots of Resilience: Nurturing Mindfulness Through Gardening
description: Step into a calming space where nature and mindfulness come together in Roots of Resilience: Nurturing Mindfulness Through Gardening. This unique experience invites you to connect with the earth while cultivating resilience and well-being through the mindful practice of gardening. As you nurture plants and engage with the soil, you'll discover how the act of tending to nature can reduce stress, promote inner calm, and foster personal growth.This 90-minute experience is open to everyone, whether you’re a seasoned gardener or completely new to the practice. In a supportive and relaxing environment, you’ll learn how the simple, grounding process of gardening can help you reconnect with yourself and the world around you.Please wear comfortable, outdoor-appropriate clothing, as you’ll be engaging directly with the earth. All tools and materials will be provided. The session is gentle and can be adapted for all fitness levels, so you can participate at your own pace. If you have any health concerns or physical limitations, please inform the facilitator in advance, and adjustments will be made to ensure your comfort.While the experience is designed for all, please note that bookings are non-refundable and non-cancellable. Should you have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out to us at info@zuva.life. We look forward to sharing this grounding journey with you, helping you grow both in the garden and within yourself.

name: Screening: Annie Hall (1977) | Movie Under the Stars
description: Join us for an open-air screening of Annie Hall (1977), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movieAnnie Hall (1977) is a romantic comedy directed by and starring Woody Allen, alongside Diane Keaton. The film follows the neurotic comedian Alvy Singer (Allen) as he reflects on his relationship with the quirky, free-spirited Annie Hall (Keaton). Through a series of flashbacks, Alvy recounts the ups and downs of their romance, exploring themes of love, identity, and personal growth. The film’s non-linear narrative, breaking of the fourth wall, and witty dialogue set it apart, making it a landmark in modern romantic comedies. Annie Hall won four Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Actress for Keaton.3-Course Dinner MenuCourse 1Bell Pepper, Broccoli and Zucchini QuicheCourse 2Spaghetti and Meatballs (Chicken / Vegetarian)Served with garlic breadCourse 3﻿Devils food cake with red wine & cherries______Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

description: Courtyard's monthly playdate with The LooRoo Club is back!Join us at the yard to celebrate the magic of Diwali – The Festival of Lights!The morning will begin with a storytelling session of the interactive board book “Kahaani Puraani” by T4Tales. There will be Diyas and Diwali treats, nature lanterns and painting! Expect a burst of color, laughter, and play as we immerse your little ones in the joy and nostalgia of Diwali.Come be part of this vibrant celebration and let’s bring this cherished festival to life!Plus, the kids will take home a copy of the book as a special keepsake! For Kids aged 3- 6 years and their parentsTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. name: Viva La Vino Wine Festival: Bangalore Edition
description: Viva La Vino - Bangalore EditionGet ready, Bangalore - The city’s most exciting wine, cheese, and chocolate festival is here! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari and Devati Mallick, Viva La Vino promises the best wines, great vibes, and unforgettable moments—no fuss, just pure fun. Experience an evening of tasting wines with old and new wine pals in a full-on festival setting! Whether you're new to wine or a seasoned pro, VLV will have you falling in love with the wine life all over again.What’s in store:60+ Wines from around the world! – Sip, swirl, and savour a curated lineup of Indian and international wines. Discover exciting new flavours from different corners of the world, scout for your new favourite wines, or revisit old classics with a twist. Taste & Buy – Loved a wine? We’ve got you covered! Get special prices on on-the-spot orders at the festival, which will be delivered later.Artisan Cheese & Chocolate – Heaven on a plate! Meet the makers behind some of the finest homegrown cheese and chocolate, perfect for pairing with the wines. Sample, chat, and take home your favourites at special prices.Exclusive Masterclass – 25 seats only! People who sign up for this will score access to a one-hour masterclass with industry experts, featuring premium wines not available at the festival (trust us, these are a must-try!)Music & Entertainment – A banging festival playlist to keep the vibes going all night while you sip, socialize, and explore!Live Food Stations – Indulge in mouthwatering bites at live stations curated by our venue partners—perfect for wine-ding down after all that serious tasting (phew!)!Wine Games & Trivia Zones – Ready for some fun? We’ve got interactive wine games that’ll test your wine knowledge and keep you entertained all evening. Whether you're into trivia, drinking games (wink wink!), or playful challenges, there’s something for everyone.Get your tickets now and join us for a wine-filled, fun-packed evening! Bring a friend, partner, a bunch of wine buddies or swing by on your own, but you can't miss this. #SeeyouatVLV?

location.address: Kumarakrupa Rd, opposite Golf Club, Kumara Park East, Seshadripuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Viva La Vino
organizer.description: Welcome to VLV – the ultimate wine festival! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari (Magic Cellars) and Devati Mallick (Drink With D), VLV travels across 6 cities, celebrating wine, culture, and community. Join us for the best wines, fun vibes, and unforgettable memories. See you at #VLV?

This popup allows them to showcase their innovative approach to Roman-style pizza and engage the community ahead of the grand opening, setting the stage for an exciting new chapter in the Brik Oven journey.Small BitesFritters (Veg) - 490/-Zucchini Blossom | Cream Cheese | Citrus Zest | Tajin Fritto Misto (Seafood) - 532/-Beer Batter Prawns and Squid | Tomato and Soy Vinaigrette | Cherry Tomatoes | BasilPizza RomanaMargherita (Veg) - 308/-Marinara | Fresh Mozzarella | Basil Peppers & Rucola (Veg) - 378/-Marinara | Roasted Bell Peppers | Garlic | Rucola | Feta | EVOO Bianco (Veg) - 350/-White Sauce | Roasted Potatoes | Onions | Mozzarella | Ricotta | Mushrooms | Truffle Oil Pollo Affumicato (Non-Veg) - 448/-Marinara | Mozzarella | Smoked Chicken | Smoked Pineapple | Jalapeno | Sautéed Onion Amatriciana (Pork) - 448/-Marinara | Mozzarella | Bacon | Parmesan | Oregano | Pepper | EVOO Pepperoni (Pork) - 420/-Marinara | Mozzarella | Pepperoni | Stracciatella | Fermented Hot Honey DessertTiramisu (Egg) - 420/-Espresso | Dark Rum | Savoiardi | Mascarpone | Cocoa Ginger & Date Pudding (Egg) - 392/-Olive Oil Emulsion | Mascarpone | Orange Terms and Conditions: The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.Conservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

name: heartfelt yoga session , cacao with ecstatic dance
description: Come and immerse yourself in the upcoming retreat that promises a holistic experience combining yoga sessions, a heart-opening cacao ceremony, and liberating ecstatic dance. Delve into a day filled with joy, relaxation, and a feast for the senses with delectable and nourishing food offerings. This retreat offers a unique opportunity to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul in a tranquil setting surrounded by like-minded individuals seeking inner peace and self-discovery

name: Ramen Rush 10
description: RAMEN RUSH 09:Our ever-popular ramen weekend is back this September! Sign up now!19-20 October, 2024Lunch: 12 & 2 pmDinner: 7 & 9 pmRamen bowls are Rs 550 each + taxes.Samurai Pork RamenYakei Chicken RamenTemple Broth Ramen (vegan)Apart from ramen bowls, we also feature:TASTY STARTERSEXPANSIVE BOBA MENUAUTHENTIC JAPANESE RAMEN BROTHS: CHICKEN, PORK, HAM & VEGANDESSERTS FOR YOUR SWEET TOOTHBook your table via this link, by paying Rs 300. This is a cancellation fee, which will be adjusted against your final bill.We only take direct payments via cash, cards and Gpay/PhonePay.During this event, we cannot honour aggregator payments such as, but not limited to, Zomato Payment, MagicPin, EasyDiner etc.

name: New India Lodge -1950. A Food Theatre Experience in Bangalore
description: Step into the Past, Dine in a Story: Join the Immersive Theatrical Feast! 🍽️ 🎭Experience "New India Lodge: Athithi Devo Bhava" - A Journey Beyond TimeWritten by Shubhra ChatterjiDirected by K V Divya RaniFood by The Nommers - Home Cuisine CollectiveProduced by paChaak ProductionsAre you ready for an unforgettable culinary voyage through the pages of history? Calling all Luru Foodies to an extraordinary event that will whisk you away to a bygone era and a tantalizing journey of flavors!🌐 Witness the Unseen, Dine with Our Characters: Your Personal Invitation to the 1940's 🌐Picture this: You step into a world where reality blurs with fiction, guests merge with actors, and your dinner is transformed into an enchanting theatrical adventure. Welcome to "New India Lodge: Athithi devo Bhava," an immersive play that takes you to Independence-era India.🚪 Enter the New India Lodge, a secret locationAs you cross the threshold, you'll be transported back to the 1940s. No longer just a guest, you'll become a character in this captivating narrative.🍽️ Taste the HistorySavor a meticulously curated meal, each dish representing a different region of India. The flavors of Gujarat, Kerala, Punjab, Karnataka, and more come together in a culinary symphony.🎭 Become Part of the StoryFrom the Bohri & Gujarati tradesman to the Malyali family to the Punjabi bride, every character has a tale to tell. Interact with them, uncover their secrets, and immerse yourself in their lives.🔮 Unveil Hidden NarrativesEngage in conversations enter world of intrigue and charm. Who's a fellow guest, and who's a performer? Only time will reveal the truth.🎉 Brought to you by paChaak Productions, India's first Immersive Dining Experience curatorsThis exclusive event is an innovative collaboration between your love for food and your thirst for immersive experiences. Get ready to be delighted, engaged, and transported in ways you've never imagined!🎟️ Get Your Tickets NowSecure your spot at this one-of-a-kind event that combines history, drama, and culinary artistry. Limited seats available – don't miss your chance to be part of New India Lodge: Athithi Devo Bhava.📣 Join Us in Rewriting History Through a Magical Journey of Food and Stories! 📣InstructionsHeads up: Our secret location will be shared 24hrs prior to the show. Comfy shoes for the short walk, but once inside, it’s socks or barefoot to keep our vintage floors shining! 🧦✨Feel free to come dressed in 1950s Style, Be Part of the Story

location.address: Cubbonpete, Nagarathpete, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560002, India

name: MF DOOM & friends: Halloween Edition
description: MF DOOM, the legendary British-American rapper and producer, is renowned for his intricate lyrics, unique flow, and mysterious persona. His influence on underground hip-hop is unparalleled, and his work continues to inspire fans and artists worldwide. On Sunday, October 27, from 6 PM onwards, On The Jungle Floor is hosting MF DOOM & friends (Halloween Edition) at Indiranagar Social, Bangalore to pay homage to DOOM—this time through the rich, immersive sound of vinyl.DOOM tragically passed away on Halloween 2020, making this tribute all the more poignant as we celebrate his life and legacy. Joining us are Sachin Bhatt (aka "bhattchin") and Maddwax, longtime followers and collectors of DOOM, who have spent years building enviable collections of his rarest records, sourced from around the world. Whether you’re a new listener or a long-time fan, we suggest you throw on your best costumes and join us for what will be an unforgettable night!

name: Rooting For Tubers Festival
description: Get ready, Bangalore! Rooting for Tubers is back and better than ever. This year’s festival brings you an exciting mix of food, culture, and nature, all wrapped up in the humble yet powerful tuber. It’s a fun, family-friendly day out, co-curated by Spudnik Farms and culinary creatives, to celebrate the vibrant world of tubers. Come with your friends, family, or even solo, and immerse yourself in a one-of-a-kind experience exploring flavours, traditions, and sustainability!Whether you're a food enthusiast, an eco-conscious eater, or someone looking for a relaxed picnic-style festival, Rooting for Tubers will leave you inspired and hungry for more!What’s in store:15+ Community & Market StallsExplore diverse stalls featuring local farmers, producers, and communities, all sharing unique tuber varieties and other farm-fresh produce. Discover exciting new ways to cook with tubers, support small-scale farmers, and stock up on your favourite finds at the market.  Interact and meet various tuber growing communities from across India!Culinary Stalls & Live CookingWatch chefs in action as they cook up delicious tuber-inspired dishes! Learn from the best as they explore tubers in creative and sustainable ways, showcasing the potential of these crops in modern cooking.Workshops & TalksLearn from experts in hands-on workshops, including fermentation, traditional cooking methods, and nutrition. Engage in conversations around biodiversity, sustainable food systems, and the cultural significance of tubers, while interacting with both culinary professionals and farmers.Art Installation & Tuber DisplayDelve into the artistic side of tubers through a collaborative art installation, featuring a colourful display of various indigenous tuber varieties. Discover the beauty and biodiversity of tubers while learning about the role they play in climate resilience and food security.

This is a great way to meet new people if you are new to the city. This is a beginner-friendly class.

name: A Bavarian Oktoberfest with SAPA Sourdough & Pastry
description: This festive event will honor the classic tradition of serving iconic Old Bavarian dishes curated by Dina Weber, founder of SAPA Bakery, perfectly paired with carefully selected beers to create an authentic Oktoberfest experience at the courtyard!About OktoberfestOktoberfest is a world-famous beer festival that originated in Munich, Germany, in 1810. It began as a celebration of the marriage between Crown Prince Ludwig (later King Ludwig I) and Princess Therese of Saxe-Hildburghausen. The festivities were so popular that they became an annual event, evolving into the massive cultural celebration it is today.The festival is known for its vast beer tents, traditional Bavarian music, folk dancing, parades, and delicious German food, such as pretzels, sausages, and roast chicken.A Bavarian Oktoberfest at CourtyardThink hearty Bavarian favorites—all dished up by Chef Dina Weber from SAPA Sourdough & Pastry. Add in perfectly paired beers,Chef Dina’s menu for this event will evoke the nostalgia of southern Germany, Austria, and Alpine ski holidays, with hearty dishes that bring warmth and tradition to every bite. True to SAPA's baking roots, the event will also feature colorful gingerbread hearts, or Lebkuchenherzen, decorated with icing and German sayings. These delightful treats are traditionally worn as necklaces during Oktoberfest and will be available for guests to wear and enjoy.What’s pouring on tap?Bira's German Style Wheat Beer Hefeweizen Creamy, low bitterness with hints of banana and clove (4.7% ABV)Bira's German Style Märzen LagerMalty, full-bodied with refreshing pine aromas (4.5% ABV)SAPA MenuLeberkaese Brötchen Bun with German pork spam, beer mustard and sauerkraut Currywurst Bratwurst with spiced ketchup and soft rollKaese bretzel mit obazda Pretzel with Bavarian beer and camembert butter cheese Schweine wammerlPork belly, jus and mash Servietten Knödel with sauce and Rotkraut Fried Old bread dumpling, veg jus and apple red cabbage Käse Spätzle German egg pasta with gruyere and Gouda, caramelised onion Kartoffel Salat mit Bratwurst German potato salad with barbecue sausageApfelstrudel Flakey pastry filled with apple and raisins in vanilla anglaiseNOTE:Entry tickets are priced at ₹500 (excluding taxes) and include one 250 ml pour of beer. All attendees aged 5 and older must have a ticket; however, beer will not be served to patrons under the age of 21.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.All attendees aged 5 and older must have a ticketNo liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Barter Your Own Book Sundowner
description: Looking for your next great read? 📚 Join us for an evening where you’ll discover a new read, bond with fellow readers, and get to take a new book home!How it works?1️⃣ Bring a book wrapped in paper that you’re excited to share2️⃣ Add a teaser note to the cover to spark someone else’s curiosity3️⃣ We stack up the books and each one picks one that catches their eye from the pileOnce everyone has a new book in hand, we’ll unwrap them and dive into half an hour of silent reading. Afterward, we’ll gather to share our first impressions, swap stories about how these books found us, and enjoy some lovely evening tea and snacks.🗓️ Sunday, 27th October🕐 5 PM📍 Hey Brewty Studio, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore📣 Limited spots of 20. Sign up soon.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table**Tickets are for entry and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.
